episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the chemical composition of nacho cheese, the origins and effects of different types of noise, the historical use of the pointing hand icon, and a unique football team composed entirely of players with the same surname.

facts.fact: Sodium citrate, the chemical you add to cheese to make it melty nacho cheese, contains sodium, carbon, hydrogen and oxygen, or according to the chemical symbols, N, A, C, H and O.
White noise was named because the pattern of its waves resembles white light, and pink noise was named because it resembles pink light. Brown noise was named after someone called Robert Brown.
When you hover over a link on the computer and the mouse icon turns into a little hand, that icon dates back to the 11th century.
There was a football match in Germany last year where one team was made up entirely of players called Krotanovic.
